articles.author: Paul Ziobro
articles.title: UPS, Teamsters Reach Handshake Deal on New Contract
articles.description: Teamsters negotiators said they have tentatively agreed to a new five-year contract with United Parcel Service Inc., a deal that promises to raise wages for existing workers but creates a new class of lower-paid drivers to handle weekend deliveries.

articles.author: Joe Flint
articles.title: ABC Plans Spinoff of 'Roseanne' Without Roseanne
articles.description: ABC and the production company that makes ‘Roseanne’ are moving forward with a spinoff of the hit sitcom that was canceled after star Roseanne Barr made a racist tweet.

articles.author: Sara Germano
articles.title: Puma Gives Basketball Another Shot
articles.description: Puma is returning to men’s basketball shoes having signed endorsement contracts with four top draft prospects, including Deandre Ayton and Marvin Bagley III, ahead of the draft in New York Thursday night.

articles.author: Matthew Gutierrez
articles.title: Phoenix Suns Select Deandre Ayton No. 1 in NBA Draft
articles.description: The 19-year-old Bahamian played one season at Arizona, where he averaged 20.1 points and 11.6 rebounds per game.

articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.title: Eurozone Agrees on Final Details of Plan to End Greece's Bailout
articles.description: The ministers needed to complete a deal between Greece and its creditors that would allow it to safely emerge from its third bailout program on Aug. 20.

articles.author: Summer Said , Benoit Faucon , Christopher Alessi
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Iran says it opposes OPEC plan to raise oil output
articles.description: Iran said late Thursday it was still opposed to a deal to lift oil output, fraying a growing sense of consensus among OPEC members and putting it at loggerheads with Saudi Arabia, the cartel’s de facto leader.

articles.author: Dan Gallagher
articles.title: CEO Loss Forces Intel to Face Its Future
articles.description: The surprise resignation of Intel’s CEO means the chip maker needs to deal with longer-term challenges now.

articles.author: Shalini Ramachandran
articles.title: Two Titans' Rocky Relationship Stands Between Comcast and Fox
articles.description: Tensions between Comcast CEO Brian Roberts and 21st Century Fox Executive Chairman Rupert Murdoch are complicating Comcast’s pursuit of the biggest media deal in years. Both Comcast and Disney, who are vying for Fox’s entertainment assets, are seeking to coun…

articles.author: Melanie Grayce West
articles.title: New York Struggles to Deal With Migrant Children
articles.description: After traveling thousands of miles to New York from the U.S.-Mexico border, children are suffering from anxiety and depression as many reside in foster care, doctors say.

articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.title: Macron's Next Good Fight - Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Wall Street Journal Macron's Next Good Fight Wall Street Journal For his next magic act, Emmanuel Macron wants to reform France's creaking social-welfare programs. The French President last week released a Twitter video and delivered a speech launching a deba…

articles.author: Joseph C. Sternberg
articles.title: Don't Count on an Aging Germany to Save the Euro - Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Firstpost Don't Count on an Aging Germany to Save the Euro Wall Street Journal Angela Merkel and Emmanuel Macron formulated the beginnings of a deal this week to make the eurozone viable, if you want a eurozone of the sort they desire. Their plan is important…

articles.author: Lukas I. Alpert
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Acclaimed conservative columnist Charles Krauthammer dies at 68
articles.description: Charles Krauthammer, the Pulitzer Prize-winning conservative columnist whose incisive critiques made him an influential voice in Washington for decades, has died. He was 68.

articles.author: Waverly Colville
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: AmTrust shareholders vote to go private in $2.95 billion deal
articles.description: AmTrust Financial Services Inc. said Thursday that shareholders approved its plan to be taken private by two New York families and a private-equity firm.

articles.author: Larissa Zimberoff
articles.title: A Burger Joint Where Robots Make Your Food
articles.description: Creator, a San Francisco restaurant set to open this month, will offer a $6 gourmet burger, cooked and assembled with no human help

articles.author: James Mackintosh
articles.title: How to Trade a Trade War - Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Wall Street Journal How to Trade a Trade War Wall Street Journal Markets follow a well-worn pattern after Donald Trump's pronouncements, a pattern followed by tax, North Korea and trade. There is a sharp reaction—up or down—on the first news, fading as doubts…

articles.author: Richard Rubin
articles.title: State Sales-Tax Officials Rev Their Engines - Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Wall Street Journal State Sales-Tax Officials Rev Their Engines Wall Street Journal WASHINGTON—State tax officials began preparing to use the new sales-tax collection power the Supreme Court handed them on Thursday. Some states could move within weeks or mont…

articles.title: Is the Partisan Divide in Washington Actually Getting Worse?
articles.description: The Democratic and Republican parties are both split internally. But is the partisan divide widening? The Wall Street Journal's Gerald F. Seib explains. Photo: Getty

articles.author: Yuka Hayashi
articles.title: New York-Based Judge Rules CFPB's Structure Is Unconstitutional - Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Wall Street Journal New York-Based Judge Rules CFPB's Structure Is Unconstitutional Wall Street Journal A federal judge in New York on Thursday ruled that the structure of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is unconstitutional, diverging from an appeals…

articles.author: Lalita Clozel
articles.title: Big Banks Clear Fed's Stress Tests
articles.description: The Federal Reserve said the largest U.S. banks were healthy enough to withstand a severe economic downturn and would continue lending during a crisis, as the industry posts record profits and prepares for a wave of regulatory relief.

articles.author: Erin Ailworth
articles.title: This $2.5 Billion Wildfire Charge May Be Just the Beginning for California Utilities
articles.description: The parent of California’s largest investor-owned utility plans to take a $2.5 billion charge related to a spate of deadly wildfires that swept the northern part of the state last October.
